intro: Anacyclus ciliatus, commonly known as the hairy thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with hairy margins, and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a loose cluster. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Anacyclus ciliatus is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as fields and roadsides.
